projects.title: Design System for Meta Ads' Lift
projects.summary: A design system for an ever-expanding Meta Ads product.
projects.context: Lift is a Meta Ads product used by Meta's largest advertisers to A/B test ad strategies.
projects.the problem: Lift quickly ballooned into many Meta Ads products with no consistent design system, causing confusion and churn. Based on Lift setup, 10 different interfaces could be shown during Results.
projects.the solution: A scalable, adaptable, well-documented design system with a mix of custom components and components inherited from the larger Meta Ads design system. The Lift Results Design System, a living document with code-ready components.
projects.My Role: Sole product designer working in a traditional XFN team.
projects.Impact: 90% of Lift Results components were Design System-compliant before the Meta Ads-wide org target date. Significant UX Quality metrics improvements, net neutral effect on time spent in the short-term. 16 UX inconsistencies and improvements I suggested after my initial audit. 13/16 improvements shipped within the first milestone of this project.
projects.notes: Note: If you are interested in learning more about this complex project, I have a much more in-depth Keynote presentation that gets into the real nitty-gritty details of this project. Feel free to e-mail me at andresarbelaez08@gmail.com
projects.evidence: Shows product design and design engineering skills through shipping production-ready design system components, achieving 90% compliance rate, and improving UX quality metrics.

projects.title: Prototyping Mesh: An Open Financial System for IDEO's CoLab
projects.summary: A proposed community-wide mesh network for peer-to-peer transactions in low-connectivity scenarios.
projects.context: The IDEO CoLab is a branch of the legendary IDEO company, focused on prototyping emerging technologies in collaboration with a portfolio of companies and a network of design technologists and policy-makers.
projects.the problem: What happens to the micro-economics of a community when internet connectivity is out of the question? (ex. power outages, natural disasters, rural areas of low internet connection)
projects.the solution: A proposed community-wide mesh network, with Raspberry Pi nodes communicating through Bluetooth protocols. This network allows for peer-to-peer transactions by creating a shared ledger that is uploaded to utility vehicles (such as US Postal Service trucks), which then download the ledger transactions to their appropriate financial institutions upon reaching an area of higher internet connectivity.
projects.My Role: Product designer working with two other teammates, a policy expert from Harvard/MIT and a finance expert from Fidelity.
projects.Impact: With the IDEO CoLab's focus on future-facing projects, impact is hard to quantify in a traditional product sense. However, this project did spark new and important conversations on the direction of open financial systems.
projects.evidence: Shows product design skills through prototyping emerging technologies and designing solutions for complex, future-facing problems in collaboration with cross-disciplinary experts.

projects.the solution: A growth-focused, strategic addition of contextual upsells and toggles across various Meta Ads surfaces.

projects.title: Mobile iOS development for Instagram Promote
projects.summary: Enabling faster load times for Instagram Promote.
projects.context: Instagram Promote is Meta's in-app product flow for launching and managing Instagram Ads.
projects.the problem: Instagram's main codebase was written in Objective-C, while the Instagram Promote product was written in React Native. This created a slow loading experience when launching Instagram Promote, ultimately leading to unwanted churn for high-intent users.
projects.the solution: A more performant React Native bridge front-end programming logic, allowing for faster load times for Instagram Promote.
projects.My Role: Sole software engineer, advised by colleagues on the Instagram Promote eng team, as well as the React Native eng team.
projects.evidence: Shows design engineering and software engineering skills through optimizing React Native bridge performance, achieving a 300% reduction in Time-To-Interaction.

projects.title: Confidant - Offline AI Assistant
projects.summary: An open-source, privacy-first AI assistant that provides offline AI health consultation. All processing happens locally with no network access for queries.
projects.context: Confidant is an AI assistant optimized for health and legal questions, running completely offline using local LLMs and RAG over a knowledge base.
projects.the problem: Users need privacy-first AI assistance for sensitive health and legal questions, but most AI assistants require internet connectivity and send data to external servers, compromising privacy.
projects.the solution: A fully offline AI assistant that runs optimized LLM models (Mistral-7B-Instruct, Llama-3.2-3B) locally via llama.cpp, with RAG capabilities using ChromaDB and sentence-transformers. All processing happens client-side with no network access.
projects.My Role: Sole designer and developer. Built the desktop app architecture (Tauri 2.0 + React + TypeScript + Rust), implemented RAG system with ChromaDB, integrated local LLM inference via Python subprocess, and designed the privacy-first architecture.
projects.Impact: Demonstrates expertise in privacy engineering, local AI deployment, RAG systems, and desktop app development. The project has evolved from Python/Raspberry Pi to web app to desktop app, showing iterative product development.
projects.evidence: Shows product design, full-stack development, AI integration, and privacy engineering skills through building a complete offline AI assistant with local LLM inference, RAG capabilities, and desktop app architecture.

projects.title: Agentic Portfolio Website
projects.summary: A Windows XP-themed portfolio website with a RAG-powered AI agent that answers questions about Andr√©s's work and experience, using vector embeddings and retrieval-augmented generation.
projects.context: A portfolio site that demonstrates both design and engineering skills through a nostalgic Windows XP interface, combined with modern AI capabilities.
projects.the problem: Traditional portfolios are static and don't engage visitors. Recruiters and founders want to ask questions and get specific evidence of skills, but portfolios only show finished work without context.
projects.the solution: A portfolio that combines a nostalgic, interactive Windows XP UI with a RAG-powered AI agent. The agent has access to resume content and project details through vector embeddings, allowing it to answer questions, cite specific projects, and point to evidence of skills.
projects.My Role: Sole designer and developer. Designed the Windows XP aesthetic, implemented the RAG system, built the chat interface, and integrated OpenAI/Ollama for local and production AI.
projects.Impact: Demonstrates full-stack capabilities, AI integration, and creative design through a functional portfolio that actively engages visitors and provides evidence-based answers about work and experience.
projects.evidence: Shows product design, design engineering, and full-stack development skills through building a complete portfolio site with AI integration, RAG implementation, vector embeddings, and a cohesive Windows XP-themed UI.
